lexUnit.name: jabber.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: talk rapidly and excitedly but with little sense.

sentence.text: ` I knew it was n't safe , " she jabbered .
` Look at this bloody lot Josh , " he jabbered excitedly , ` I 've never sin the water so thick with 'em before . "
` I saw that bush move as I passed , " Mary jabbered excitedly , ` I was scared for a sec , but I moved the bush and there it was . "
I do n't … you must n't — ” she jabbered .
He jabbered about football for the first five minutes to smother her angry silence .
And while they were up there in the wide , blue yonder , they jabbered non-stop to each other over the radio .
The four of them , ignoring him , were setting the trolley up again , jabbering among themselves in Kamalian .
The servant girl came into my chamber and told me that there was a ` sort of demon " downstairs , jabbering in a strange tongue .
Normally , Mickeen would detain you as long as he could , jabbering away about this , that and the other .
He jabbered away to his friends , and Ellie assumed he was explaining that item number one was a drink .
She held the telephone receiver at a distance from her ear while first , Janet , and then Felicity , jabbered on .
Franco continued to jabber away , his words interspersed with little outbursts of laughter .
They were designed to unnerve you , to make you start jabbering indiscreetly .
